comments.body: They should also be tamablee in some way to use them as a food source.

The babies do the lowest damage of any hostile mob, and they also run away after being attacked, so they aren't an issue. As for the adults, they can be repelled using warped fungi, although you do have to place it on nylium(doesn't matter which, but it can't be placed on normal netherrack).

Currently a shield works just fine in 1v1, but multiple hoglins at once still pose a problem. Personally, I think you should be able to repel hoglins by simply holding the fungi in your hand/offhand, but it might make it too easy to deal with them.

It's the NETHER!

It's supposed to be hard!
But not too hard. I just was frustrated because I was swarmed by like 5 before I made this post so i only raged a little

I believe so too. I have just spawned in a crimson forest, and it's nearly unplayable. I was chased by about 30 hoglins at once (as I was running from about 5 more and more agrro-ed on me), and I only managed to get out by doing a sort of divide and conquer strategy: which took about 45 minutes. Also, when holding a shield, hoglins can still fling you in the air which does a lot of damage without feather falling. Personally, I think they should only attack in groups of 2 or less. In larger groups, they would feel more safe and wouldn't attack. I think seeing as they have the health of endermen, take little to no knock-back, and can run very quick: I believe that they should be neutral in larger groups. Separating them from endermen but not making them overpowered. I think hoglins should also lose a lot slower than the player. If the idea is that they are big and bulky, and as a result take little knock-back and have a lot of health: I think they should also be a lot slower to keep in line with this

I agree. I spawned in a Crimson Forest and I can't go anywhere without getting cornered by a bunch of hoglins. Even with the piglins that spawn and help kill them, there's only so much I can do against a bunch of tanks. I have a set of iron armor (gold boots) and a shield. They even have a really long reach so it makes it even more difficult to hit them with my iron axe. And then it still takes 4-5 hits with that to kill them with that. A bow would most likely work best, but they have so much health and it's too difficult to take them down without them demolishing you.

I definitely second this. With a diamond sword and shield and nearly full (except for 1 gold piece) of iron armor I can't kill 3 before their constant attacks overwhelm me or break my shield and overwhelm me. They also spawn so prolifically even if you build in a warped fungus biome the neighboring crimson forest biome is so overrun with Hoglins they push into the warped forest biome and short of carpeting the entire biome there's no way to mitigate their spawn rate.

I've also never, not once, seen a group of piglins kill a hoglin. The hoglin always wins. It's gotten to the point where if I get ambushed by Hoglins in the nether I just don't bother anymore and quit the game for the day to wait for them to despawn. They're just not fun to fight in any way shape or form.

I mean I get that the Nether is supposed to be 'hard' but the hoglins make crimson forest biomes unplayable. How are super tough, super fast, super powerful, high knockback, high spawn rate, super-aggressive monsters that lack any form of meaningful mitigation mechanic fun? How do they not read as a big middle finger to player exploration?

Hoglins are the most un-minecraft monster to be added since Phantoms and they really need to either be severely retooled or just removed. As they are there is nothing fun about them.

I agree with this completely.I played in full diamond armor save for a gold helmet to keep the piglins at bay, and I was two-shotted by a single hoglin while using a diamond sword and shield. Another time, I was knocked back into lava and lost everything I had. And even if you aren't knocked into lava it's impossible to go back and retrieve your inventory afterwards because by the time you get back there's 500 more hoglins than there were before. The nether is supposed to be challenging, but it's not supposed to be impossible. As it is I haven't been able to play in the nether for more than 5 minutes at a time before I'm slaughtered by a hoglin and have to turn off the game because I'm so overwhelmed. All I want is some gotdang netherwart to cure a zombie villager and I can't get deep enough in the nether to find a single fortress because of all the hoglins in the way in every direction. I'm not exactly a scrub when it comes to combat, but the hoglins make the nether unplayable.

so so overpowered, every hardcore run of mine was ended by the insane spawn rate of the unstopeble piglins that have so much reach, so much hp, they deal way to MUCH damage, they are insanely fast and the nilyum trees keep blocking my way but piglins with whatever reasone are 1 block tall so the can just go trough!

YESSS!!! Tell me what Mojang was thinking making this. Seriously‚Ä¶ THEY CAN HIT YOU BEFORE YOU HIT THEM. With a sword at least. How is that fair? Especially when they hit you really fast taking out 3 hearts each time. I tried killing one with my fists and guess how many hits it took‚Ä¶ 40!! Are you serious mojang???!!! And then you go ahead and make them spawn in 2‚Äôs or 3‚Äôs like I‚Äôm really starting to think either mojang doesn‚Äôt like it‚Äôs fan base anymore, or is just out of touch with how fair and basic these games should work. And that‚Äôs not even including the other pigmen who spawn out of nowhere in 3‚Äôd rapid hitting you and killing you almost instantly. Tell me mojang how is this fair? So let‚Äôs see on one hand we have the fat pigs who run fast, do high dmg, can hit you first, and take forever to kill! And on the other we have idiotic pigmen who will spawn behind you, get to you in 1.5 seconds and start beating you with there buddies who also spawn next to him.
Mojang: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs make an enemy who spawns in bunches, is really fast, hits you before you can hit them, and have a lot of health. That seems fair. Right mojang???

ik this is three years old but these things hit you like 8 blocks into the distance and shields dont even bock their attacks, they do once then the next one boom your launched, got launched into the lava twice, losing all my stuff, these things need to be nerfed
Think it should affect projectile speed, that way it naturally increases range.

It‚Äôs hard to see what your doing and would be much easier to use if it was over the shoulder like every other game ever.

Perhaps it would be a good idea to have the backup prompt sometimes open when the world is opened, not only when upgrading it to a newer version. For instance, if you have played more than 10 hours or so in the world without having created a backup, the game would prompt you to create a new backup the next time you try to open the world. That way, lag caused by the backup while playing in the world would be prevented.
Hope they added for BE too

Or maybe things that seem a little more Minecraft - y like the outline of a giant husk when it happens in deserts, the outline of a big polar near creature when it happens while snowing, the iconic creeper face in plains, slime face in swamps, that tall giraffe or llama creature in savannas and that whale creature or massive elder guardian towering over oceans.

I like that idea more than I thought I would.
Good idea.  I hope you get more votes.
I like this, it‚Äôs got a stranger things vibe to it.

That would scare kids. Remember, Minecraft isn't a horror game. It's for fun, and you don't want your little brother or sister freaking out and quitting minecraft forever because they saw a "giant ghost fishy" in the sky and it screamed.
this comment is a reply to orithyus, remember minecraft is rated 10+by the esrb so little kids under 10 shouldnt be playing the game
I don‚Äôt like the idea cuz I could get nightmares. I‚Äôm just a kid!

I mean this might scare kids but it seems nice it would be nice if they were actual storm sounds not like these ones because I don't think kids are scared of thunder storm noises depending on if they are close or not to the sound.
Makes sense.
Well, I think it should do more damage than what a cactus does, considering it is a saw.

Given how dangerous a table saw this size would be, I think it should deal about 20 damage (I think a diamond sword is 8). And it should apply to ALL mobs (including players (obviously) and villagers), armor stands, sand and gravel should break, and I think even the wither and ender dragon. Any items that drop on top of it should be scooted off in one direction about 3 blocks.
It makes a lot of sense and y wouldnt it be in game it is a saw and you can be killed by a berry bush

I mean the plants are useful for early game and mass production even without farming machines, while animals require way more constant work to get the food and really only get overwhelmingly better once you have a huge stock and looting on a weapon.

I do think it'd be nice to see a varied diet being helpful, but I don't think each food needs a specific benefit.
I agree with @ConcertedSea1 not all foods need to have a benefit.

I think suger rush should also give jump boost and could stack.
Once the effect wear off you get a equalivent sugar crash effect which slows you down

I do not necessarily think that all food should have an extra benefit, but I do like it for the ones who make some sense, like the sugar rush and the night vision carrots(as long as it doesn't make the potion useless). I don't think the meat really needs extra buffs since it is pretty good already

another idea to balance food is to make some other types of food easier to make/ farm, as I think it is pretty strange that it takes two wheat to raise a cow, and three wheat to make bread. Also, the mobs seem to get born and grow up faster than crops grow.

So it is not only/so much that the types of food itself are out of balance, but probably more the way of producing it as well.

This! Every food should be useful. Every consumable and piece of equipment should be useful.

It's a bummer that I have no reason to grow crops that aren't wheat or in potions, or raise animals other than cows, or bake practically anything. There are so many items that I never make because they aren't useful or interesting.

Everything should enhance gameplay. Variety is good and all but I think a strong focus on making that variety interesting is key. Otherwise, it's in the game forever just so it could be useful in the first 20 minutes once, as only a stepping stone to something that is interesting or useful, or for someone who wants to roleplay.

I'm talking about game design methodology here that others won't feel as strongly as me about but I'm a firm believer that upgrading should expand possibilities rather than obsolete new or previous accomplishment, especially in a game with so many potential play styles.
Hi

Or... it should be a spawn point and beds should be for sleeping. I play on a private server with my friends and when I visit and it gets dark, I sometimes sleep on their spare beds in their house. I don't want to replace my spawn point to a place that I'm sleeping in temporarily, nor do I want to travel back and sleep in my bed every time.

Hey, I like this idea, I think it would be cool if you could also have a spawnpoint in the Nether and in the End using crying obsidian, so if you died, you could respawn there instead of in the Overworld again

you should use the logs found in the netherwart forests instead of blue ice, as intermediate people can obtain ice in a tundra if they live in or near one. you can also fight blazes easily if you use a bow and drink a fire resistance potion. Endermen can also be killed easily with a powerful diamond sword in two hits with powerful enchantments. they should also show its own unique particles when activated (set the spawn point on).
This block is perfect for a rebirth point in Nether. Was the idea conceived back in 2012? And now there is just a reason to add this block.

While I agree that this would make sense if the mechanic had been in the game from day one, I disagree that they should change it.  It is an established mechanic and a very useful one.

It is not as overpowered as it used to be, either.  At least in my experience.  My water based drop chutes went from me taking no damage to me dying if I only had one block of water to fall through at the end a few months back. (in bedrock, which is what I play)

Fall damage is an important mechanic, but there also needs to be a way to reliably nullify it.  Water is that method in this game, even if jumping in water from a height is anything but safe.
I remember in old versions of minecraft what you say now was in these versions but people didn't like it so they changed it . Sorry for my bad english
Technicially you can fall from an infinate hight (Assuming you just tp yourself hundreds of thousands of blocks high) and fall and safely land in 1/8 of a block of water and be fine
Minecraft doesn't need to mimic real life and I don't think anyone is going to try to jump into water because in Minecraft it negates fall damage. its a stupid reason to change something.
